name: KEVIN 'TYLER' COX
summary: Senior backend engineer with TypeScript/Java/C# service development, GraphQL API design, and document databases (DynamoDB, Firestore). Strong serverless background (GCP Cloud Functions; familiar with AWS Lambda) with CI/CD and SRE practices (Grafana/Prometheus/Loki/Tempo). Built internal tools and reliable event-driven pipelines (CDC→Kafka); security-first with Keycloak/OIDC, PKI, and TLS/mTLS. US Eastern; 6+ hours overlap with Pacific time; comfortable with occasional travel.

workExperience.description: Design and delivery of services and platform tooling across internal applications; emphasis on observability, automation, and secure‑by‑default practices.
workExperience.keyAchievements:
Delivered RESTful services in Java Spring Boot and C#/.NET to support logistics workflows and front‑end applications.
Modeled operational data for streaming via CDC → Kafka; established medallion layers (bronze/silver/gold) to improve lineage, SLAs, and reprocessing.
Implemented identity and transport security with Keycloak (OIDC/SAML), Kerberos, internal CA/PKI, and TLS/mTLS.
Built observability with Grafana/Prometheus/Loki/Tempo, SLO dashboards, and alerting; authored runbooks and supported incident response.
Standardized CI/CD with GitHub Actions and GitLab Runners; automated environment provisioning with Ansible; supported Kubernetes deployments.
Created internal tools/admin views for operations teams to manage workflows and data quality.
Collaborated across product/design/engineering, providing estimates, highlighting risks/mitigations, and leading code/design reviews.

projects.title: ODEYA.app (Angular + SSR)
projects.description: Personal web app that auto‑curates YouTube playlists from collections of channels so new uploads flow into a single playlist.
projects.keyAchievements: Implemented server‑side rendering for SEO; componentized TS code; reduced manual upkeep via aggregation logic.
projects.name: ODEYA.app

projects.title: Backend Patterns — GraphQL + Document DB
projects.description: TypeScript GraphQL APIs with schema‑first design and resolvers backed by document databases.
projects.keyAchievements: Data modeling in DynamoDB (single‑table concepts) and Firestore; serverless functions (primary: GCP Cloud Functions; familiar: AWS Lambda); added metrics hooks compatible with Prometheus/Grafana.
projects.name: Backend Patterns — GraphQL + Document DB

projects.title: Observability Enablement (Grafana Stack)
projects.description: Service health/SLO dashboards with Prometheus metrics, Loki logs, and Tempo traces; alerting integrated with deployments.
projects.keyAchievements: Trace‑led debugging across services; consistent dashboards; seeded runbooks and escalation paths.
projects.name: Observability Enablement

projects.title: CI/CD Blueprint & Ansible Provisioning
projects.description: Reusable pipelines (GitHub Actions/GitLab Runners) and Ansible roles for consistent build/test/deploy across on‑prem and cloud targets.
projects.keyAchievements: Reduced lead time to change; standardized quality gates and environment promotion; improved reliability.
projects.name: CI/CD Blueprint

projects.title: Data Flow Modernization (CDC → Kafka → Medallion)
projects.description: Database‑level CDC streaming into Kafka, organized into bronze/silver/gold layers.
projects.keyAchievements: Improved reliability, lineage, and downstream transformations; clearer SLAs and reprocessing.
projects.name: Data Flow Modernization

skills.title: Backend & Cloud
skills: Serverless: GCP Cloud Functions; AWS Lambda (familiar)
